data.title: Why Facebook Stock Surged Today
data.text: A gridlocked government could help reduce the risks for the social media giant's shareholders.

data.title: Don't expect a change in administration to impact on Big Tech antitrust regulation: Strategist
data.text: Open Markets Institute's Sally Hubbard speaks with Yahoo Finance's Aikiko Fujita about how a new administration could impact Big Tech antitrust regulation. #BigTech #antitrustregulation #YahooFinance Subscribe to Yahoo Finance: https://yhoo.it/2fGu5Bb About Yahoo Finance: At Yahoo Finance, you get free stock quotes, up-to-date news, portfolio management resources, international market data, social interaction and mortgage rates that help you manage your financial life.

data.title: Why Big Tech stocks are up as election results continue to be counted
data.text: Big Tech stocks are higher as the chances of a blue wave seems to disappear. Ryan Detrick, LPL Financial Research senior market strategist, joins 'Power Lunch' to discuss why he thinks Big Tech stocks are gaining and why he says tech growth stocks are favorable.

data.title: Unlikely Biden would go after Big Tech like Trump: Paul Hickey
data.text: CNBC's Kelly Evans talks with Bespoke Investments' Paul Hickey about what may be next for Big Tech after the election outcome is finalized.

data.title: California just passed a major privacy law that will make it harder for Facebook and Google to track people and gather data
data.text: A new law passed by California voters in the November election will set an unprecedented standard for digital privacy in the US, making it harder for big tech companies like Facebook and Google to track people's data. The Consumer Privacy Rights Act, also known as Proposition 24, was on track to pass in California as of Wednesday morning, with 56% of voters supporting the measure and over three quarters of ballots counted.

data.title: Silicon Valley: Why Big Tech may be hoping for a Joe Biden presidency
data.text: As the country awaits the outcome of the US presidential election, Corporate America is watching closely, especially Silicon Valley.

data.title: Top Nasdaq Stocks Don't Care About the White House: Here's Why
data.text: The Nasdaq Composite had soared almost 4% by midday Wednesday.

data.title: Big Tech shares soar as fears of a blue wave stoking antitrust probes subside
data.text: Shares of Big Tech were up sharply early Wednesday after national election results strongly hinted at a split government instead of a Democratic-led blue wave and subsequent antitrust push. Shares of Facebook Inc. soared 8%, while Alphabet Inc.'s Google catapulted 7%.

data.title: Big Tech stocks soar as results still come in from nail-biter election
data.text: Shares of the major tech companies jumped early Wednesday as investors flocked toward Microsoft and the FAANG family.

data.title: Big Tech Stocks Climb As Blue Wave Doomed, Easing Antitrust Woes
data.text: Shares in Apple, Google, Amazon and Facebook gained Wednesday as a Democratic blue wave seemed doomed in U.S. elections, easing worries over tougher antitrust enforcement for big tech. The post Big Tech Stocks Climb As Blue Wave Doomed, Easing Antitrust Woes appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.

data.title: Election: California votes on a new kind of watchdog for Big Tech
data.text: California voters overwhelmingly approved the creation of a new regulatory board dedicated to data privacy Tuesday night, building on its first-in-the-nation attempt to oversee the data collection of tech companies.
